trans-unit.source: The abstract base class that defines methods for serializing and deserializing versions of WS-Trust response (RSTR) messages.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustResponseSerializer"></xref> class.
When overridden in a derived class, checks if the specified XML reader is positioned at a WS-Trust RequestSecurityTokenResponse element.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object from which to read.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the reader is positioned at an RSTR element that this serializer can read; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> class that this class can serialize or deserialize.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object.

When overridden in a derived class, deserializes the RSTR from an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object to a <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object.
The XML reader over the RSTR.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object if the deserialization was successful.
When overridden in the derived class reads a child element inside the RSTR.
An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> object positioned at an element to read inside the RSTR.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> element that is being populated from the reader.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
Validates the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object that has been deserialized.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityToken"></xref> object to validate.
requestSecurityTokenResponse is .
When overridden in a derived class, writes the supported elements on the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object to the outgoing stream.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object to serialize.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> to write to.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.

When overridden in a derived class, serializes the specified <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object into the <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object to serialize.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> to write to.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
When overridden in a derived class, writes a child element inside the RSTR.
The <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> object to which the RSTR is being serialized.
The local name of the element to be written.
The value of the element.
The <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse"></xref> object that is being serialized.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Protocols.WSTrust.WSTrustSerializationContext"></xref> that contains the current serialization context.
